crisis_scenarios.title: Supply Chain Disruption
crisis_scenarios.narrative: Your key supplier has just declared bankruptcy. Production is at risk of grinding to a halt within days. Your operations team is anxious, and customers are already asking about delivery delays.

choices.text: Pay premium for emergency air-freight from an overseas supplier
choices.feedback: Expensive but effective. Your team appreciates the decisive action, and customers remain satisfied with on-time deliveries.

choices.text: Pivot to a local supplier with slightly higher costs
choices.feedback: Smart long-term thinking. The new partnership reduces future supply risk and builds local business relationships.

choices.text: Sue the bankrupt supplier for breach of contract
choices.feedback: Legal action initiated, but recovery from a bankrupt company is uncertain. Production still needs an immediate solution.

crisis_scenarios.title: Key Employee Resignation
crisis_scenarios.narrative: Your star performer just handed in their resignation. They've received a competing offer with 40% higher salary. Other team members are watching closely to see how you respond.

choices.text: Match the competitor's offer to retain them
choices.feedback: They stay, but this sets a precedent. Other employees may try similar tactics. However, team morale improves seeing you value top performers.

choices.text: Let them go and promote an internal candidate
choices.feedback: The promoted employee is grateful for the opportunity. Some knowledge is lost, but you've shown there's a path for advancement.

choices.text: Negotiate a phased transition with training program
choices.feedback: Professional handling impresses everyone. Knowledge transfer is completed, and you part on good terms. They might even refer future candidates.

crisis_scenarios.title: Customer Data Breach
crisis_scenarios.narrative: Your IT team has discovered a security breach. Customer data may have been exposed. Regulators require notification within 72 hours, and the media is already sniffing around.

choices.text: Immediately disclose to all stakeholders and offer free credit monitoring
choices.feedback: Transparency is costly but builds long-term trust. Customers appreciate the proactive approach, and regulators note your compliance.

choices.text: Investigate fully before making any public statement
choices.feedback: The delay allows rumors to spread. When you finally announce, people question why it took so long. Regulators are not pleased.

choices.text: Hire a crisis PR firm to manage the narrative
choices.feedback: Professional crisis management limits damage. The story fades quickly, but some customers remain wary.

crisis_scenarios.title: Cash Flow Crunch
crisis_scenarios.narrative: A major client has delayed payment for 90 days, and payroll is due next week. Your bank is reluctant to extend more credit. The team doesn't know yet.

choices.text: Negotiate emergency factoring on your receivables
choices.feedback: You lose some margin to the factor, but payroll is made. Crisis averted, and the team never knew how close it was.

choices.text: Be transparent with employees and ask for delayed payments
choices.feedback: Some employees understand, but many are worried. A few start looking for other jobs. Trust is damaged.

choices.text: Pursue aggressive collection with the late client
choices.feedback: You get partial payment, but the relationship is strained. They may not renew their contract next year.

opportunity_scenarios.title: Viral Social Media Moment
opportunity_scenarios.narrative: A customer's positive review has gone viral. You have a 24-hour window to capitalize on this unexpected publicity. Your marketing budget for the month is already allocated.

choices.text: Boost the viral post with paid advertising
choices.feedback: The investment pays off! Your brand reaches millions of potential customers. Sales inquiries spike for weeks.

choices.text: Respond personally and offer the customer a brand ambassador role
choices.feedback: Authentic engagement resonates with audiences. The customer becomes a loyal advocate, creating ongoing organic promotion.

choices.text: Launch an impromptu flash sale to capture the attention
choices.feedback: Quick revenue boost! However, some existing customers feel left out of the deal. Mixed long-term impact.

opportunity_scenarios.title: Acquisition Offer
opportunity_scenarios.narrative: A larger competitor has approached you about acquiring your company. They're offering a premium valuation, but your team has mixed feelings about losing independence.

choices.text: Decline and double down on independent growth
choices.feedback: Your team is energized by your commitment to the vision. You've sent a signal to the market about your confidence.

choices.text: Negotiate a strategic partnership instead of acquisition
choices.feedback: Best of both worlds. You maintain control while gaining access to their resources and distribution channels.

choices.text: Use the offer as leverage to seek other investors
choices.feedback: The competitive interest drives up your valuation. New investors are impressed by the acquisition offer.

opportunity_scenarios.title: Automation Technology
opportunity_scenarios.narrative: A new AI-powered system could automate 30% of your operational tasks. Implementation would take 3 months and require retraining staff. The ROI projections look promising.

choices.text: Full implementation with comprehensive training program
choices.feedback: Disruption during implementation, but long-term efficiency gains are significant. Staff appreciate the investment in their skills.

choices.text: Pilot in one department before company-wide rollout
choices.feedback: Lower risk approach yields valuable learnings. The pilot team becomes internal champions for the technology.

choices.text: Wait for the technology to mature and prices to drop
choices.feedback: Prudent financially, but competitors who adopt early may gain an advantage. Innovation reputation takes a small hit.

opportunity_scenarios.title: Investment Opportunity
opportunity_scenarios.narrative: You have excess capital and two investment options: expand into a new market or acquire a smaller competitor. Both have potential but carry different risk profiles.

choices.text: Expand into the new market organically
choices.feedback: Organic growth builds a strong foundation. Your team learns the new market deeply, creating sustainable competitive advantage.

choices.text: Acquire the competitor for immediate market share
choices.feedback: Instant scale, but integration challenges arise. Cultures clash initially before finding common ground.

choices.text: Keep cash reserves for future opportunities
choices.feedback: Conservative but safe. You maintain optionality for unexpected opportunities or challenges ahead.

tutorial_scenarios.title: Your First Campaign
tutorial_scenarios.narrative: Welcome to your new role! Your first task is to plan a marketing campaign for the upcoming product launch. Your budget is limited, and expectations are high.

choices.text: Focus on social media for broad reach
choices.feedback: Great choice for a limited budget! Social media provides excellent reach and engagement opportunities.

choices.text: Invest in targeted email marketing
choices.feedback: Email marketing has excellent ROI and allows direct customer communication. Smart use of your budget.

choices.text: Plan a launch event with local press
choices.feedback: Events create memorable experiences! The personal touch generates buzz and media coverage.
